text: hey everybody thomas joseph here with
another kitchen conundrum that i know
you all have grilling steaks properly
oftentimes people find that they have
what we call here in the Test Kitchen
the bullseye effect and that is when
your steak it looks great on the outside
but when you cut into it it's actually
rare in the middle raw almost in the
middle and that's what it means that's
the bullseye effect so red in the center
but on the outside it's overcooked I'm
going to show you how to do this
perfectly so we're going to forget about
this guy here and there are a few tricks
and tips that I will show you along the
way that will help to prevent that so I
have an 18 ounce strip steak you can use
ribeye steaks any states that you love
whatever your favorite is and you want
to make sure that you pull this out of
the refrigerator you want to kind of get
the chill out of the meat so at least
thirty minutes up to 45 and what you
want to do is take a paper towel and
really dab off any excess moisture
because what happens if you have excess
moisture when you're searing it creates
steam and it's not going to be a
wonderful crust on the outside and then
a little drizzle of a neutral flavored
oil something with a high smoke point
and what that means a high smoke point
the temperature of the oil can go much
higher and that's when it achieves its
smoke so just a little drizzle of I'm
using grapeseed oil here but safflower
oil would work well and then a liberal
sprinkling of salt and coarsely ground
pepper and you really need to be
generous here because this is this is
all the seasoning it has it's not
penetrating into the meat really it's
just creating a nice seasoned crust so
now I have a very very hot cast-iron
skillet here and this is a grill pan but
you could certainly do this in a just a
regular cast-iron skillet or you could
use your grill but you want high high
heat to start so I'm going to take the
steak and I'm going to place it at a 45
degree angle with the ridges of the pan
and
is what's going to create those
wonderful crosshatch marks that you see
in the restaurants hi hi wheat you can
hear this year you want to cook it for
about two minutes and then rotate it and
cook it for another two minutes more so
it's been about two minutes just like
that another two minutes more and then
we'll flip it now if you have a smaller
steak if your steak is maybe one inch
thick you want to do this for less time
on each side so maybe a minute and then
another minute and then you flip it over
depends on the thickness of the steak
another two minutes and I'm going to
flip it and you'll see it has those
wonderful grill marks that we love so
another two minutes on one side we're
going to rotate it again another two
minutes and then it's going to go into
the oven to finish cooking all right I'm
going to transfer this to a quarter
sheet ring here with a rack and this is
going to help it's not going to steam
the bottom of the steak it's going to
help with the airflow around the steak
and help cook it if you're doing this
outside on your barbecue what you want
to do is you want to change the heat
source so originally starting with
direct heat directly under the steak you
want to move the heat away from the
steak to the perimeter of your grill so
what that does is it creates almost an
oven which will help cook the steak at a
nice even rate so into them so it's been
about 10 minutes and I'm going to temp
the steak right in the center from the
side and we want the state to register
about 120 125 degrees for me
rare so it's perfect it's at about 121
degrees and now I'm going to remove it
from the rack and I'm going to rest it
which is very important for about ten
minutes before slicing it what that does
is it helps the juices to redistribute
throughout the meat so if you cut it now
all the juices would pour out you're
going to end up with something that's
kind of dry
so steak has been resting for about ten
minutes and I'm just going to slice it
in half to show you so there you have it
a perfectly cooked steak nice and medium
rare not raw inside at all and all that
took for a few simple tricks if you have
any kitchen conundrums that you need
solved comment below or reach out to me
using the hashtag kitchen conundrums and
I will solve whatever kitchen problems
you may have
you
